item.title: Windows 10 KB5058481 update brings seconds back to calendar flyout
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the optional KB5058481 preview cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 with seven changes, including restoring seconds to the time display in the calendar flyout for those who previously lost it. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5058499 update rolls out new Share and Click to Do features
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5058499 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with forty-eight new features or changes, with many gradually rolling out, such as the new Windows Share feature and tje Click to Do Preview. [...]

item.title: APT41 malware abuses Google Calendar for stealthy C2 communication
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Chinese APT41 hacking group uses a new malware named 'ToughProgress' that abuses Google Calendar for command-and-control (C2) operations, hiding malicious activity behind a trusted cloud service. [...]

item.title: New PumaBot botnet brute forces SSH credentials to breach devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A newly discovered Go-based Linux botnet malware named PumaBot is brute-forcing SSH credentials on embedded IoT devices to deploy malicious payloads. [...]

item.title: Interlock ransomware gang deploys new NodeSnake RAT on universities
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Interlock ransomware gang is deploying a previously undocumented remote access trojan (RAT) named NodeSnake against educational institutes for persistent access to corporate networks. [...]

item.title: Botnet hacks 9,000+ ASUS routers to add persistent SSH backdoor
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 9,000 ASUS routers are compromised by a novel botnet dubbed "AyySSHush" that was also observed targeting SOHO routers from Cisco, D-Link, and Linksys. [...]

item.title: Dark Partners cybercrime gang fuels large-scale crypto heists
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A sprawling network of fake AI, VPN, and crypto software download sites is being used by the "Dark Partner" threat actors to conduct a crypto theft attacks worldwide. [...]

item.title: Czechia blames China for Ministry of Foreign Affairs cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Czech Republic says the Chinese-backed APT31 hacking group was behind cyberattacks targeting the country's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and critical infrastructure organizations. [...]

item.title: Microsoft introduces new Windows backup tool for businesses
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has introduced Windows Backup for Organizations, a new backup tool for enterprises that simplifies backups and makes the transition to Windows 11 easier. [...]

item.title: Microsoft wants Windows to update all software on your PC
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has introduced a new update orchestration platform built on the existing Windows Update infrastructure, which aims to unify the updating system for all apps, drivers, and system components on Windows systems. [...]

item.title: Apple blocked over $9 billion in App Store fraud in five years
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Apple says it blocked over $9 billion in fraudulent App Store transactions over the last five years, with over $2 billion in potentially fraudulent sanctions prevented in 2024 alone. [...]

item.title: DragonForce ransomware abuses SimpleHelp in MSP supply chain attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The DragonForce ransomware operation successfully breached a managed service provider and used its SimpleHelp remote monitoring and management (RMM) platform to steal data and deploy encryptors on downstream customers' systems. [...]

item.title: Iranian pleads guilty to RobbinHood ransomware attacks, faces 30 years
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: An Iranian national has pleaded guilty to participating in the Robbinhood ransomware operation, which was used to breach the networks, steal data, and encrypt devices of U.S. cities and organizations in an attempt to extort millions of dollars over a five-year span. [...]
